Kit, are the 3.2.1 lang packs all finalized?

There are two problems here:

1) The translated files are not valid XHTML or XML. I cannot view the standalone documents in IE or firefox (I get garbage). The XHTML spec says:

"An XML declaration is not required in all XML documents; however XHTML document authors are strongly encouraged to use XML declarations in all their documents. Such a declaration is required when the character encoding of the document is other than the default UTF-8 or UTF-16 and no encoding was determined by a higher-level protocol."

2) The dynamic content processor converts documents to utf-8 but do not change the meta tag containing the charset, thus confusing the browsers.

I'm not sure there's much we can do for 3.2.1. The earliest I can fix #2 is 3.2.2 if it happens.
*** Bug 163287 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Curtis, I just tried eclipse-SDK-I20061114-1636-win32.zip with IBM J2RE 1.5.0 SR3 in zh_TW locale. Still see the same problem. The same exceptions are logged into the log file.
Thanks Kit, I'll take a look at this for 3.2.2.

Fixed in 3.2.2 in 3.2 (both #1 and #2).

The errors were still happening because I was reluctant to add a workaround to tolerate the missing xml declarations (#1). I've added the workaround to both 3.2.2 and 3.3, and tested both with the 3.2.1 lang packs with 1.4.2 and 1.5.0 Sun and IBM JREs, in both zh_TW and ja locales. With next wednesday's 3.2.2 maintenance build and next tuesday's 3.3 integration build you should be able to view the documents properly and you should get no log errors when searching.

Case closed.

Created an attachment (id=54724)
.log file

Curtis, I just tried M20061122-0800. I was able to display tasks-53.xhtml and tasks-57.xhtml in Traditional Chinese in Help. However, I still see the exceptions in the .log file.

I was using Sun's JVM. Not sure if there is anything to do with that:
java.version=1.4.2_10
java.vm.info=mixed mode
java.vm.name=Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM
java.vm.specification.name=Java Virtual Machine Specification
java.vm.specification.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
java.vm.specification.version=1.0
java.vm.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
java.vm.version=1.4.2_10-b03

Fixed the log error.

You're right. The crimson parser (present in only some Sun JREs) was still giving us trouble when trying to determine whether a doc is xhtml or not. I've modified the implementation to avoid using the parser for this and using a simple string compare.
I've verified the problem is fixed in eclipse-SDK-M20061214-1600-win32.zip (buildId=M20061214-1600), in zh_TW locale, Sun 1.4.2_10-b03 JRE.
